response.summary:
BIM Specialist and Civil Engineer with 4+ years of experience applying my skills in 3D modeling, design review, clash detection, 3D coordination, training, mentoring, and technical support using BIM software. 
In addition, I've effectively carried out cost estimations and feasibility studies for construction projects worth up to $13 million. My BIM proficiency extends to tools such as Revit, Revizto, Procore, Navisworks, Synchro, and AutoCAD.
response.skills: SQL, ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Products, Budget Estimating, Cost Management, Procore, Navisworks, Synchro, Building Information Modeling (BIM), Revit, Revizto, Autodesk BIM 360, Geographic Information Systems (GIS), SIDRA, Construction Estimating, Construction Drawings, Microsoft Excel, Feasibility Studies, Elaboración de presupuestos, Control de costes

profile_positions.description:
• Modeling, design review, clash detection, and multidisciplinary coordination in high-profile MEP and electrical projects using Revit and Revizto.
• Generation of manufacture and construction drawings. 
• Production of As-built models.
• Training, mentoring, and providing technical support in Revit to indigenous people.
profile_positions.title: BIM Specialist

profile_positions.description:
• Deliver budgets with a deviation smaller than 3% compared to the final project value.
• Careful calculation of quantities of construction materials.
• Estimation of costs associated with labor, materials, and project duration.
• Review of project documentation.
• Provide economic feasibility studies and preliminary estimates for building projects.
• Negotiation with contractors.
profile_positions.title: Budget Engineer

profile_positions.description: I started working as a planning intern for six months, and after that, I got a fixed-term contract as a planning assistant. I did the following activities: • Calculation of quantities of construction materials. • Estimation of construction costs.
profile_positions.title: Planning Assistant

profile_positions.description: I gave technical support to elaborate "Manual of speed limits in Colombian urban roads". This manual establishes a methodology for calculating the speed limit on Colombian urban roads, considering parameters such as hierarchy and typologies of the road, geometry, land uses, and others.
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description: I developed activities related to the research project named "Application of the most advanced technologies to strengthen the research and response to seismic, volcanic and tsunami activity events and the improvement of risk management in the Republic of Colombia” The activities that I did are: • Development of a georeferenced database of structural attributes of buildings at San Andrés de Tumaco and Buenaventura, Colombia. • Generation of cartographic data using Geographic Information Systems tools (GIS) to define the damage and structural vulnerability states.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Activities related to a collaborative project between the National University of Colombia and the Mayor's Office of Santa Marta city. The main goal of this project was to optimize the traffic light network of the city of Santa Marta, Colombia. The activities that I carried out in this project were:  
•	Local optimization of each traffic light in the city of Santa Marta through the Sidra computer program. •	Studies of traffic delays. •	Studies of vehicle, pedestrian, and bicycle volumes.
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant

school.name: Algonquin College of Applied Arts and Technology
Algonquin College of Applied Arts and Technology

company.name: Innovation Seven - T.I.7 Inc.
company.description:
I7 was founded to provide innovative infrastructure, housing, and economic solutions to the complex problems that Canada’s Indigenous populations face. We believe that these solutions should live on and benefit the succeeding seven generations through increased opportunity and a higher quality of life.

I7 understands that the first step to improving the current state for Canada’s Indigenous population involves listening. The problems of Canada’s First Nation, Inuit, and Métis population have long been overlooked and misunderstood due to a lack of communication. Taking the pulse of the market is essential to being able to develop a viable transaction that will benefit all stakeholders involved. To that end, I7 maintains close working relationships with Indigenous clients, the private marketplace, and government departments to better comprehend the needs of all parties.

I7 strives to always represent the best interests of our clients, who rely on us to provide them with the best advice based on due diligence and consideration of modern methodologies and leading industry practices.

Developing a framework from the outset of the project which embraces the principles of collaboration and inclusion, a clear mandate, respectful and appropriate communications, and innovation, is our commitment.
